A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This is a pointless film. Or perhaps\, it simply implies the rest of the franchise is and has always been pointless. The Force Awakens invalidated the entire saga up until that point: the Empire’s gone\, but it’s back... the Rebellion is gone\, but it’s back... the Republic is back\, but it’s gone... the Jedi are back\, but they’re gone... the Sith are gone\, but they’re back... The Last Jedi carries on this tradition by invalidating the entire plot of The Force Awakens. Who’s Snoke? Who cares! Who’s Rey? Who cares! Want a story about the Skywalker family? Who cares! In short\, the mysteries posited by The Force Awakens were always going to disappoint some people... I guess I just wasn’t prepared to be disappointed by the answers to every single question I had. At the end of the day\, the biggest heartbreak of this movie comes in the sense of failed completion at its end. No victory is earned\, no “peace and purpose” achieved\, yet it tells us this is what has arrived. For the first time in my entire life\, I have no further questions for Star Wars - nor do I care to see where the franchise goes next.
